{{infobox shopping mall | | shopping_mall_name = SM City Sucat | image = SM Supermalls Logo.png | image_width = 200px | caption = ''"We've got it all for you!"''
''"The Supercenter Turned Into A City Mall"'' | location = Dr. A. Santos Avenue., San Dionisio, Paranaque City, Metro Manila | opening_date = {{Â·}}'''Main Building:''' ''July 13, 2001''
{{Â·}}'''Annex Building:''' ''April 2005'' | owner = [[Henry Sy|Henry Sy, Sr.]] | number_of_buildings = 2 | number_of_stores = 300 Shops & Restaurants | floor_area = 98,106 mÂ² | parking = 1000 cars | floors = 3 | website = [http://smsupermalls.com/smsupermalls/index.php?p=651&mall=26 SM City Sucat Official Website] }} '''SM City Sucat''' (formerly '''SM Supercenter Sucat''') is a shopping mall owned by [[SM Prime Holdings]]. It is located in Dr. A. Santos Avenue corner Carlos P. Garcia Avenue Extension (C5), Brgy. San Dionisio, Paranaque City, Metro Manila. It is the first SM Supermall in the city of ParaÃ±aque and the 2nd SM Supermall in the southern region of [[Metro Manila]] . The mall now has two buildings connected by a lengthy footbridge. This mall caused several smaller shopping malls nearby to close, such as the nearby Airport Citimall (now Oyster Plaza), which closed in 2003. == Buildings == === Main Building === The first building of the mall. The main building features SM Hypermarket, SM Cinemas & SM Food Court and other retail shops. === Annex Building === The second building was built after the main mall, completed in 2005. It features the SM Department Store and other shops. == See also == *[[SM Prime Holdings]] *[[SM Mall of Asia]] *[[SM Megamall]] *[[SM City Sta.
